gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 8,31]]Jesus said to those Jews who believed in him, "If you remain in my word, you will truly be my disciples,
[[Jn 8,32]]and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free."
[[Jn 8,33]]They answered him, "We are descendants of Abraham and have never been enslaved to anyone. How can you say, 'You will become free'?"
[[Jn 8,34]]Jesus answered them, "Amen, amen, I say to you, everyone who commits sin is a slave of sin.
[[Jn 8,35]]A slave does not remain in a household forever, but a son always remains.
[[Jn 8,36]]So if a son frees you, then you will truly be free.
[[Jn 8,37]]I know that you are descendants of Abraham. But you are trying to kill me, because my word has no room among you.
[[Jn 8,38]]I tell you what I have seen in the Father's presence; then do what you have heard from the Father."
[[Jn 8,39]]They answered and said to him, "Our father is Abraham." Jesus said to them, "If you were Abraham's children, you would be doing the works of Abraham.
[[Jn 8,40]]But now you are trying to kill me, a man who has told you the truth that I heard from God; Abraham did not do this.
[[Jn 8,41]]You are doing the works of your father!" (So) they said to him, "We are not illegitimate. We have one Father, God."
[[Jn 8,42]]Jesus said to them, "If God were your Father, you would love me, for I came from God and am here; I did not come on my own, but he sent me.

psalm.title: Book of Daniel
psalm.text:
[[Dn 3,52]]Blessed are you, O Lord, the God of our fathers, 
praiseworthy and exalted above all forever; 
and blessed is your holy and glorious name,  
praiseworthy and exalted above all for all ages.

[[Dn 3,53]]Blessed are you in the temple of your holy glory, 
praiseworthy and exalted above all forever.
[[Dn 3,54]]Blessed are you on the throne of your kingdom, 
praiseworthy and exalted above all forever.

[[Dn 3,55]]Blessed are you who look into the depths 
from your throne upon the cherubim; 
praiseworthy and exalted above all forever.
[[Dn 3,56]]Blessed are you in the firmament of heaven, 
praiseworthy and glorious forever.

first_reading.text:
[[Dn 3,14]]King Nebuchadnezzar said: "Is it true, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, that you will not serve my god, or worship the golden statue that I set up?
[[Dn 3,15]]Be ready now to fall down and worship the statue I had made, whenever you hear the sound of the trumpet, flute, lyre, harp, psaltery, bagpipe, and all the other musical instruments; otherwise, you shall be instantly cast into the white-hot furnace; and who is the God that can deliver you out of my hands?"
[[Dn 3,16]]Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego answered King Nebuchadnezzar, "There is no need for us to defend ourselves before you in this matter.
[[Dn 3,17]]If our God, whom we serve, can save us from the white-hot furnace and from your hands, O king, may he save us!
[[Dn 3,18]]But even if he will not, know, O king, that we will not serve your god or worship the golden statue which you set up."
[[Dn 3,19]]Nebuchadnezzar's face became livid with utter rage against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. He ordered the furnace to be heated seven times more than usual
[[Dn 3,20]]and had some of the strongest men in his army bind Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego and cast them into the white-hot furnace.
[[Dn 3,91]]King Nebuchadnezzar rose in haste and asked his nobles, "Did we not cast three men bound into the fire?" "Assuredly, O king," they answered.
[[Dn 3,92]]"But," he replied, "I see four men unfettered and unhurt, walking in the fire, and the fourth looks like a son of God."
[[Dn 3,95]]Nebuchadnezzar exclaimed, "Blessed be the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, who sent his angel to deliver the servants that trusted in him; they disobeyed the royal command and yielded their bodies rather than serve or worship any god except their own God.
first_reading.title: Book of Daniel
